tool.name: Drop Flagged Features or Samples.
tool.command:
drop_flags.py --input $input --design $design --ID $uniqID --flags $flags --outWide $outWide --outFlags $outFlags --flagDrop $flagToDrop --value $reference --flagfiletype $typeofdrop
#if $flagUniqID --flagUniqID $flagUniqID #end if #if str( $conditional ) == '0' --condition '0' #end if #if str( $conditional ) == '1' --condition '1' #end if #if str( $conditional ) == '2' --condition '2' #end if

param.name: input
param.label: Wide Dataset
param.help: Input dataset in wide format and tab separated. If file is not tab separated see TIP below.

param.name: design
param.label: Design File
param.help: Design file tab separated. Note you need a 'sampleID' column. If not tab separated see TIP below.

param.name: flags
param.label: Flag File
param.help: Input flagged dataset containing the flag value for each feature.

param.name: uniqID
param.label: Unique Feature ID
param.help: Name of the column in your Wide Dataset that has unique Feature IDs.

param.name: flagUniqID
param.label: Unique ID for Flag file (feature ID or sample ID)
param.help: Name of the column in your Flag file that has unique Feature IDs.

param.name: flagToDrop
param.label: Flag to Drop
param.help: Name of the column/row in your Flag File to drop.

param.name: conditional
param.label: Condition of drop.
param.help: Select type of conditional to compare in flags.

param.name: reference
param.label: Cutoff Value
param.help: Reference value to make comparison. Any rows/columns with a flag value equals,greater or less than this number will be dropped.

param.name: typeofdrop
param.label: Type of drop to be used.
param.help: Select whether you want to drop by rows or by columns, default rows.

tool.help:
@TIP_AND_WARNING@
**Tool Description**
The tool either drops features (rows) or samples (columns) from the wide format dataset based on the flags from the flag file specified by user. The user has to specify a flag file and its type. The flag file should be either wide format flag file used for features or design format flag file used for samples. The difference between the flag file formats is described in the beginning of the user manual. For the flag file the user has to specify the name of the column that has feature (sample) names as well as the name of the column containing flags. Either flag files produced by SECIM Tools or imported separately to Galaxy can be used in this tool. User has an option to specify which value of the flag column should indicate dropping.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Input**
- Two input datasets are required.
@WIDE@
**NOTE:** The sample IDs must match the sample IDs in the Design File (below). Extra columns will automatically be ignored.
@METADATA@
@FLAGS@
@UNIQID@
**Unique ID for Flag file (feature ID or sample ID).**
- Name of the column in your Flag file that has unique Feature IDs.
**Flag to Drop.**
- Name of the column/row in your Flag File to drop.
**Condition of drop.**
-Select type of conditional to compare in flags.
**Cutoff Value**
- Reference value to make comparison. Any rows/columns with a flag value equals,greater or less than this number will be dropped.
**Type of drop to be used.**
- Select whether you want to drop by rows or by columns, default rows.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Output**
This tool outputs two TSV files. The first TSV file is a wide format dataset obtained from the input wide format dataset where flagged features (or samples) have been dropped. The drooping mechanism that has been applied (features or samples) applied depended on the settings specified by the user and on the structure of the flag file. The second TSV file is the flag file from the tool input where the corresponding flagged features (rows) or samples (columns) have been dropped. The flag file produced contains only features (or rows) that have not been dropped from the wide format dataset.
